    Xuan-Toan Dang

    Phd Student

    I received my Bachelor of Engineering degree in wireless communication engineering from the Hanoi University of Science and Technology, Hanoi City, Vietnam in 2020. In 2023, I received the M.E. degree in electronic engineering from Soongsil University, Seoul, Korea. I am currently pursuing my Ph.D. degree at Soongsil University. My research interests include wireless communications with optimization techniques, machine learning, deep learning for wireless communications, and signal processing for communications.

    • South Korea
    • Soongsil University

    Publications

    You can also find my articles on my Google Scholar profile.

    Journal Articles

    Optimization of RIS-assisted Cell-free Massive MIMO Systems with Heterogeneous Graph Neural Networks under Imperfect Channel Estimation

    Published in IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology, 2025

    This study investigates a cell-free massive MIMO system integrated with a reconfigurable intelligent surface (RIS), focusing on performance under imperfect channel estimation and pilot contamination. Proposes a heterogeneous graph neural network (HetGNN) architecture to optimize the RIS-assisted CFMM system for maximizing performance.

    Recommended citation: Nguyen, Q.-S., Dang, X.-T., & Shin, O.-S. (2025). "Optimization of RIS-assisted Cell-free Massive MIMO Systems with Heterogeneous Graph Neural Networks under Imperfect Channel Estimation." IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology.
    Download Paper

    Optimizing Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning in Rotary-Wing UAV Air-to-Ground Communications

    Published in IEEE Transactions on Green Communications and Networking, 2025

    Focuses on enhancing the energy efficiency of federated learning systems utilizing rotary-wing unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) for air-to-ground communication.

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T., Nguyen, Q.-S., & Shin, O.-S. (2025). "Optimizing Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning in Rotary-Wing UAV Air-to-Ground Communications." IEEE Transactions on Green Communications and Networking.
    Download Paper

    A DDPG-LSTM Framework for Optimizing UAV-Enabled Integrated Sensing and Communication

    Published in Drones, 2025

    Presents a framework combining Deep Deterministic Policy Gradient (DDPG) and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks to optimize Integrated Sensing and Communication (ISC) systems enabled by UAVs.

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T., Eom, J.-S., Vu, B.-M., & Shin, O.-S. (2025). "A DDPG-LSTM Framework for Optimizing UAV-Enabled Integrated Sensing and Communication." Drones, 9(8), 548.
    Download Paper

    Optimization of Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning over IRS-assisted Cell-free Massive MIMO Networks

    Published in IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications, 2025

    This paper explores the optimization of energy efficiency for federated learning in an intelligent reflecting surface (IRS)-assisted cell-free massive MIMO network.

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T., Nguyen, H. V., & Shin, O.-S. (2025). "Optimization of Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning over IRS-assisted Cell-free Massive MIMO Networks." IEEE Transactions on Wireless Communications.
    Download Paper

    Combining the Viterbi Algorithm and Graph Neural Networks for Efficient MIMO Detection

    Published in Electronics, 2025

    Investigates a novel method for efficient Multiple-Input Multiple-Output (MIMO) detection by integrating the Viterbi algorithm with Graph Neural Networks (GNNs).

    Recommended citation: Nguyen, T. A., Dang, X.-T., Shin, O.-S., & Lee, J. (2025). "Combining the Viterbi Algorithm and Graph Neural Networks for Efficient MIMO Detection." Electronics, 14(9), 1698.
    Download Paper

    A Survey on Energy-Efficient Design for Federated Learning over Wireless Networks

    Published in Energies, 2024

    A comprehensive review detailing the current state-of-the-art and challenges in designing energy-efficient federated learning protocols for wireless communication networks.

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T., Vu, B.-M., Nguyen, Q.-S., Tran, T.-T.-M., Eom, J.-S., & Shin, O.-S. (2024). "A Survey on Energy-Efficient Design for Federated Learning over Wireless Networks." Energies, 17(24), 6485.
    Download Paper

    Physical Layer Security for IRS-UAV-Assisted Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems

    Published in IEEE Access, 2024

    Analyzes and enhances physical layer security in cell-free massive MIMO systems assisted by both intelligent reflecting surfaces (IRS) and unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs).

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T., Nguyen, H. V., & Shin, O.-S. (2024). "Physical Layer Security for IRS-UAV-Assisted Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems." IEEE Access.
    Download Paper

    Optimization of Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning over Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Communication Networks

    Published in Electronics, 2024

    Focuses on optimizing the energy efficiency of federated learning implementations in communication networks supported by Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs).

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T., & Shin, O.-S. (2024). "Optimization of Energy Efficiency for Federated Learning over Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Communication Networks." Electronics, 13(10), 1827.
    Download Paper

    Optimization of IRS-NOMA-Assisted Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems Using Deep Reinforcement Learning

    Published in IEEE Access, 2023

    Applies Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) to optimize the performance of intelligent reflecting surface (IRS) and NOMA-assisted cell-free massive MIMO systems.

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T., Nguyen, H. V., & Shin, O.-S. (2023). "Optimization of IRS-NOMA-Assisted Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems Using Deep Reinforcement Learning." IEEE Access.
    Download Paper

    Optimal User Pairing Approach for NOMA-Based Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems

    Published in IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology, 2022

    Proposes an optimal user pairing approach for Non-Orthogonal Multiple Access (NOMA) integration into Cell-Free Massive MIMO systems to maximize sum spectral efficiency.

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T., Le, M. T. P., Nguyen, H. V., Chatzinotas, S., & Shin, O.-S. (2023). "Optimal User Pairing Approach for NOMA-Based Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems." IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology, 72(4), 4751-4765.
    Download Paper

    Conference Papers

    Optimization of Physical Layer Security in IRSs-assisted Cell-Free Massive MIMO Systems

    Published in 2023 VTS Asia Pacific Wireless Communications Symposium (APWCS), Tainan city…, 2023

    Focuses on optimizing physical layer security in Intelligent Reflecting Surface (IRS) assisted cell-free massive MIMO.

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T., Shin, O.-S. (2023). "Optimization of Physical Layer Security..." 2023 VTS APWCS.

    Optimal User Pairing for NOMA-assisted Cell-free Massive MIMO System

    Published in 2022 IEEE Ninth International Conference on Communications and Electronics…, 2022

    Proposes an optimal user pairing scheme for NOMA integration in cell-free massive MIMO.

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T. et al. (2022). "Optimal User Pairing for NOMA-assisted CFMM." 2022 IEEE Ninth ICCE.

    A genetic algorithm based pilot assignment strategy for cell-free massive MIMO system

    Published in 2020 IEEE Eighth International Conference on Communications and Electronics…, 2021

    Investigates a genetic algorithm for pilot assignment to optimize cell-free massive MIMO systems.

    Recommended citation: Dang, X.-T. et al. (2021). "A genetic algorithm based pilot assignment strategy..." 2020 IEEE Eighth ICCE.
